intro: Sciodaphyllum inambaricum, commonly known as the inambar tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palm-like leaves and showy, red flowers. The plant is adapted to coastal environments and thrives in sandy soils with high salinity. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing dune systems and providing habitat for local wildlife. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts.
